conclusion: To determine the height H above the ground at which the fire extinguishing projectile hits the high-rise building, we need to analyze the motion of the projectile under the influence of gravity.
The projectile is launched with an initial velocity v_0 = 50 m/s at an angle θ = 53° to the horizontal.
The horizontal distance L = 60 m and the acceleration due to gravity g = 10 m/s².

premise: The initial velocity v_0 can be decomposed into horizontal and vertical components.
conclusion: Horizontal component: v_{0x} = v_0 cos θ = 50 m/s × 0.6 = 30 m/s

premise: The initial velocity v_0 can be decomposed into horizontal and vertical components.
conclusion: Vertical component: v_{0y} = v_0 sin θ = 50 m/s × 0.8 = 40 m/s

premise: The horizontal motion is uniform, so the time of flight t can be found using the horizontal distance L.
The vertical position y as a function of time t is given by y = v_{0y} t - (1/2) g t².
The height H is the difference between the vertical position y and the initial height (which is 0 in this case).
